image.altText: Sue Hickey, who is sitting in the speaker's chair in parliament looks at the Premier, Peter Gutwein, standing in front of her.

props.synopsis: Thought the chaos of Tasmanian politics was over? Think again, because upon the parliament's return, a new speaker will be elected — and if recent history is any guide, that can provide its own drama and upheaval.

title.children: Hickey, O'Byrne shows the speaker's role can bring its own drama

image.altText: A close up of wood burning in a fireplace.

props.synopsis: Robin Phillips said he was sick for days after inhaling wood heater smoke and is calling on authorities to better enforce rules around the heating device's use.

title.children: How to use a wood heater properly, and why it matters

image.altText: Two men at press conferences wear suits and stand outside.

props.synopsis: Crossbenchers who could decide the fate of Tasmania's minority government have give mixed responses to new commitments by the Liberals and Labor.

title.children: Policies ditched, promises made as Tasmania's new political reality takes shape

image.altText: Still from video of near miss between train and ute at Tasmanian rail crossing.

props.synopsis: The latest compilation video of near misses is released, as part of a plea to Tasmanian drivers and pedestrians to do better at rail crossings — with the grim warning that trains "do not apologise".

title.children: Trains 'do not apologise': Videos of close calls released in plea for safety

image.altText: A police boat under a bridge.

props.synopsis: A helicopter and police boat were initially involved in the search for the injured driver of a stolen vehicle after concerns the missing driver may have jumped into the Derwent River.

title.children: Car thief who crashed on Hobart bridge still on the run, police say

image.altText: Bagpipers in front of a billboard of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid will stop representing a man accused of murdering a Tasmanian police officer if he does not return his paperwork, a court has heard.

title.children: Legal aid threatens to walk away from representing accused cop killer

image.altText: A large circular formation of bleached coral underwater.

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the damage to coral reefs including the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo has eclipsed any previous bleaching events.

title.children: From 'hope spot' to 'skeletons': Ningaloo's 'catastrophic' event

image.altText: Two men shake hands for camera as one waves.

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron has backed Australia's decision to recognise a Palestinian state. Follow live.

title.children: Macron backs PM on move to recognise Palestinian state

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Macron backs in Albanese on Palestine

image.altText: Two large boats collide near a third vessel which they are chasing on open ocean

props.synopsis: Video shows the moment a Chinese vessel hits the front of the other while on the open sea.

title.children: Fate of Chinese crew unknown after dramatic collision in South China Sea

image.altText: A black and white photo shows a woman smiling while sitting wearing a formal dress.

props.synopsis: Mima McKim-Hill was murdered in Central Queensland in 1967. Over half a century later, her suspected killer has never faced justice.

title.children: Mima McKim-Hill died in 1967. Her suspected killer never faced justice

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to Vladimir Putin standing next to him.

props.synopsis: This week marks the first time Russian President Vladimir Putin has set foot on American soil in almost a decade — but the place he's meeting Donald Trump once belonged to Russia.

title.children: Here's why Trump and Putin picked Alaska for their first meeting in years

image.altText: An American flag and Chinese flag fly on a flagpole outside.

props.synopsis: The new 90-day pause on sky-high tariffs extends the deal to delay the reintroduction of triple-digit levies.

title.children: Trump extends China's 125pc tariff deadline for 90 days

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at the White House while holding a paper showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says his administration is seizing control of the Washington DC police department and deploying the National Guard to crack down on local crime and "clear" the city of homelessness.

title.children: Trump plans Washington police takeover to 'rescue' city from crime

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: The New York judge said the government's assertion the materials — transcripts of witness testimony heard by the grand jury that indicted Maxwell — would reveal meaningful new information was "demonstrably false".

title.children: Judge rejects Trump administration's bid to unseal Ghislaine Maxwell transcripts

image.altText: Robert F Kennedy Kr in a black suit and tie sitting at a table while speaking and gesturing with his hands

props.synopsis: Under the watch of Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr, a vaccine-preventable disease has continued to spread across the United States.

title.children: US on the brink of major public health failure

image.altText: An illustration of a young boy staring at a computer. He is surrounded by text bubbles.

props.synopsis: An investigation by triple j hack uncovers allegations of young people in Australia being sexually harassed and even encouraged to take their own life by AI chatbots.

title.children: AI chatbots accused of encouraging teen suicide as experts sound alarm

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large multi-storey hospital with a glass and concrete split level facade.

props.synopsis: FOI documents obtained by the ABC reveal staff raised concerns that no move date had been given for the new Footscray Hospital opening months before the state government announced delays.

title.children: Staff express 'lack of clarity' concerns over Footscray Hospital opening

image.altText: A photo of two people, leaning on a farm fence and looking at the camera, at their rural home

props.synopsis: Richard and Kimberly Byers went from running their own business and living comfortably to being unable to afford groceries, a story charity Foodbank says is becoming all too common.

title.children: From double incomes to 'drowning in debt', households turn to food charity

image.altText: A group of people, photographed from behind, seated in chairs and looking toward a TV.

props.synopsis: A rehabilitation centre in northern NSW says it is leaving beds empty despite lengthy waiting lists as it does not always have enough staff to operate at capacity.

title.children: Funding shortfall leaves rehab beds empty despite soaring demand

image.altText: A palm tree growing dates in a dry orchard

props.synopsis: Dates are a niche industry in Australia, but the growers' association hopes the promise of a lucrative export market and a unique geographical position could make it an appealing one.

title.children: Date industry looking for growers keen to capture 'seller's market'

image.altText: Building exterior with logo City of Parramatta

props.synopsis: Parramatta councillors have voted against seeking more information over reports the corruption watchdog raided its offices last month.

title.children: Bid for details over reported Parramatta Council ICAC raid knocked back

image.altText: A police officer with their head and face covered holds a gun beside a plain clothes officer outside a house with police tape.

props.synopsis: Heavily armed police swarm a house in Melbourne's south-east after the bodies of the man and woman were discovered.

title.children: Man arrested at railway station after two found dead in Mount Waverley

image.altText: An Iraqi man stands under an electricity transmission tower looking up at it

props.synopsis: Power goes out across the country amid a heatwave that Iraqi meteorological services expect to last more than a week, with temperatures climbing as high as 50 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Iraq experiences nationwide power outage amid 'record' heat

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: Hermes handbags, multiple properties, cash and a Rolex watch receipt for $24,000, are alleged to be part of the "unexplained wealth" of a Chinese national charged with reckless foreign interference in Canberra last week.

title.children: Court hears woman accused of foreign interference has 'unexplained wealth'

image.altText: An older couple stands outside their suburban home and smiles.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Chris Steel has written to the toll operator asking it to provide refunds to affected ACT motorists who were issued with notices for trips they did not take, due to similarities between licence plates.

title.children: Canberra drivers wrongly charged for trips on Sydney toll roads

image.altText: A husband and wife walking towards court, with lawyers standing either side of them.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has heard the helicopter pilot involved in a fatal 2022 crash — killing Matt Wright's Netflix co-star — had a reputation as "a party animal" and had been a frequent drug user.

title.children: Pilot disconnected flight meter to cover 'fishing, partying', Supreme Court hears

image.altText: Kathleen Folbigg gives an interview to NBN

props.synopsis: Speaking out for the first time after the NSW government's payout offer, Kathleen Folbigg says the lack of transparency around how the sum was calculated has left her feeling "confused" and "shocked".

title.children: 'A slap in the face': Kathleen Folbigg speaks out against $2m payout

image.altText: Nat Fyfe

props.synopsis: Dual Brownlow medallist Nat Fyfe has confirmed he will retire at the end of the 2025 AFL season.

title.children: 'I don't need anything further': Nat Fyfe to retire at end of AFL season

image.altText: The Nadesalingam family pose for the photo.

props.synopsis: Checking in with the Tamil family from the small town of Biloela who were at the centre of one of the country's biggest people-power movements of recent years.

title.children: Biloela family isn't taking its ordinary Australian life for granted

image.altText: A sillouette in black looks at a Wikipedia laptop screen.

props.synopsis: Wikipedia's operator has lost a legal challenge to British legislation which it says will drastically reduce the number of users who can access the site.

title.children: Wikipedia could reduce UK users as it loses legal challenge against safety bill

image.altText: a baby boy looking into the camera, a towel loosely covering the top of his head and back

props.synopsis: Family day care makes up just 5 per cent of Australia's early childhood education and care system, but insiders, experts and regulatory documents paint a picture of a sector beset by troubling incidents and structural risk.

title.children: Parents of boy who died in family day care urge authorities to 'wake up'

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman looking at bills.

props.synopsis: As inflation eases, many Australians are still feeling the impact of the cost of living, with the number of people experiencing financial stress almost doubling since the pandemic.

title.children: As financial strain hits, Australians struggle with money dysmorphia

image.altText: A young woman is pushed in the back of the head by a man in front of a large mob of people.

props.synopsis: A video showing a young woman being jeered at and assaulted by a large group of men as she walks across a university campus in Papua New Guinea is condemned by the university's vice-chancellor and women's rights activists.

title.children: Video of young woman mobbed at PNG university sparks outrage

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: After Catherine Ridley was bitten under her blanket by a highly venomous snake in a remote WA desert community, she made a frantic dash of more than 70 kilometres to reach medical help.

title.children: Woman faces 'worst nightmare' in being bitten by an outback king brown
